questions.question_text: "disruption" の意味はどれでしょう？
choices_text: A situation where normal operations are interrupted
A planned upgrade to a system
questions.example_sentence: The report warns that weather-related disruptions may affect global shipping schedules.
questions.explanation:
混乱・中断
計画的アップグレード
福利厚生拡大
提携発表

questions.question_text: "shortage" の意味はどれでしょう？
choices_text: A lack of necessary supplies or resources
questions.example_sentence: The industry continues to face a shortage of semiconductor components.
questions.explanation:
不足・欠乏
投資
戦略変更
余剰

questions.question_text: "estimate" の意味はどれでしょう？
choices_text: To roughly calculate or judge the value or amount
questions.example_sentence: Analysts estimate that demand will rise steadily over the next two years.
questions.explanation:
見積もる・概算する
契約締結
システム更新
法令遵守の確認

questions.question_text: "logistics" の意味はどれでしょう？
choices_text: The planning and coordination of the movement of goods
The sales performance of a product
The design of new promotional materials
questions.example_sentence: Companies are investing heavily in logistics to prevent future supply issues.
questions.explanation:
物流・ロジスティクス
売上実績
販促物デザイン
短期雇用

questions.question_text: "prioritize" の意味はどれでしょう？
choices_text: To decide what should be done first based on importance
To purchase goods at a discount
questions.example_sentence: Manufacturers are urged to prioritize essential orders during peak demand.
questions.explanation:
優先順位を付ける
過去のみを評価
割引購入
意思決定遅延
